results.title: A Practical guide to soft fruit growing
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
The definition of soft fruits are those grown on canes and bushes as opposed to trees, eg strawberries, raspberries etc. This video gives a practical guide for beginners and established enthusiasts on how to grow and produce soft fruits in a small to medium garden. It provides a most comprehensive step-by-step guide with a brief history of each plant and great close-up photography. Each fruit is covered separately and includes strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, currants and gooseberries with advice and demonstrations given on propagation, cultivation, pests and diseases treatment and prevention, and pruning. A brief summary is given at the end of each segment with a final overall summary of the key points for success at the end of the program. Written and narrated by John Walmsley and presented by Haden Williams.

results.title: A Practical guide to top fruit growing
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
Royal Horticultural Society expert Haden Williams gives practical advice on the growing of “top” fruits, ie. those produced on trees. Apples, pears, plums, peaches, nectarines and cherries are covered in the program. He advises the home gardener on the correct choice of aspect, soil preparation and drainage, feeding, pruning, grafting, and training of fruit trees into interesting forms such as fans and espaliers.

results.title: A Practical guide to herbs
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston, Charles Mills, Charles Wace, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
Presented by Jekka McVicar, this detailed Royal Horticultural Society documentary offers a practical approach to the cultivation and use of herbs for both culinary and medicinal purposes. Beginning with a brief definition and history of herbs, the program goes on to provide detailed information on the creation of a herb garden, focusing on garden design, successful propagation using a variety of techniques, pruning, protecting, harvesting and drying. McVicar’s enthusiasm for her subject is apparent as she leads the viewer on a visual odyssey through the world of herbs, sharing tips and anecdotes along the way. Examples of exceptional herb gardens, such as Rosemary Verey’s Barnsley House and Raymond Blanc’s garden at Le Manoir aux Quat’Saisons are also shown, as are herb borders and other types of container, formal, and knot gardens.

results.title: A Practical guide to propagation
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston, Celia Sullivan, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
Propagation is a way of allowing you to introduce a wide variety of plants into your garden whilst at the same time providing a cost-benefit and sense of achievement with the results. This excellent two-part program filmed at the Royal Horticultural Society’s garden at Wisley and presented by an expert team of RHS gardeners demonstrates the various techniques involved in propagating, beginning with seed sowing, and followed by division, layering, cuttings, budding and grafting, and chipping and scaling. Close-up photography and detailed step-by-step instructions covering a large cross-section of plants, choice of equipment, plus lots of useful tips and ideas make this video an ideal choice for gardeners at all levels. Presented by Anne Swithinbank.

results.title: A Pot of message
results.brief_description: Argues that Australians eat and drink too much and do not exercise enough. Because much of modern food is highly refined it lacks basic nutrition. Although there is a growing awareness of the need to eat more natural food it must be remembered that health foods and vitamin pills are not really the answer.

results.title: A Portrait of Bishhop Carlos Ximenes Belo
results.creator_credit: Max Stahl, Gillan Films and Intervision
results.brief_description: This program documents the impact of the Indonesian invasion of East Timor. It particularly focuses on the role of Bishop Carlos Ximenes Belo. He believes that he should be outspoken about the atrocities suffered by the people of East Timor because of the Indonesian occupation. The format consists of film footage depicting life in East Timor: a commentary and interviews with Bishop Belo, the Indonesian General Herman Mantiri and East Timorese people.

results.title: A Scream from silence = Mourir a tue-tete
results.creator_credit: Anne-Claire Poirier, Jacques Gagne and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This feature film documents the rape and eventual suicide of Suzanne, a nurse whose physical and emotional health deteriorates beyond repair as a result of the violence inflicted on her. Images of ritual and mass rape reinforce the horror of this act of domination. In this docudrama drawn from case histories, the filmmaker explores social attitudes that cause women to feel guilty for being raped. It touches upon the physical, emotional, spiritual and legal aspects of this crime. Cast includes Luce Guillbeault, Germaine Houde, Michele Mercure. (Awards: Chicago; Houston.)

results.title: A Pornographic affair = Une Liaison pornographique [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Frederic Fonteyne, Claude Waringo, Patrick Quinet, Rolf Schmid, ARP, Artemis Productions, Canal+, Fama Film, Le Production Lazemec, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF) and Samsa Film
results.brief_description: Two strangers, played by Nathalie Baye and Sergi Lopez, meet through a personal ad in a pornographic magazine. They are both interested in exploring a sexual fantasy that for a variety of reasons they feel shy of disclosing with regular partners. Filmed in flashback, while the two characters are interviewed straight to the camera, this erotic and intelligent film explores how men and women are navigating the fraught arena of sexual desire in a post-feminist and post-macho culture. Both Baye and Lopez deliver charming and realistic performances in which they present the ambiguities and contradictions of modern urban life: on one hand proud and happy with their independence; on the other aching for the comfort and solidity of dependency. In the end, the sexual fantasy which begins this pornographic affair, does not matter: it is up to the viewer to interpret the relationship through the nature of our own desires and fantasies. Beyond sex, desire and fantasy, “A Pornographic Affair” argues that what matters is our ability to communicate and to be open to being touched by another human being. In French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frederic Fonteyne, Claude Waringo, Patrick Quinet, Rolf Schmid, ARP, Artemis Productions, Canal+, Fama Film, Le Production Lazemec, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF) and Samsa Film

results.title: A Scenic harvest from the kingdom of pain
results.creator_credit: Joe Rees, Jonathan Reiss, IKON (GB) and Target Video
results.brief_description: Follows the performance art group Survival Research Laboratories and records three performances of the group. The setting up for a performance is shown, and interviews with some of the members of the group are conducted. The video also reports on whether injuries by the audience or performers were sustained.
